topics.body:
In a cynical point of view, less people will probably free up urban space and alleviate squalor in some of the shitty places where there's no money there to even clean it up with. Like Monrovia's ghettos.

Though, the economic and humanitarian condition won't be any better, probably. But presuming Black Death-level economics you could theorize that a drop in land costs brought on by a indiscriminate drop in population may allow for otherwise poorer people to get better land elsewhere.

But ultimate the need to improve these areas will demand significant long-term investment, which has too much risk for western economies to go into. China maybe, but they like Eastern Africa better.
